page.title: 04DITTON PRIORS DEPOT
page.content: The Depot was built in 1940 for { {storing ammunition }by the Royal Navy. The reinforced concrete floors and sturdy walls are still standing now. They are not used for depth charges and shells today but mainly farm storage by Mr.W. Lowe and the Boyne Estate.The vast complex of buildings and fields of{crops}and{grazings}land spread for 520 acres with a tarmaced road stretching for 16 miles. There are 60 sheds,80 by 50 feet in size the buildings are not damp so they are ideal for{storage.}Other uses besides{farm storage}are plastics, vintage cars, clothing materials,coal yard and furniture storage and small firms. { Bridgnorth Fencing Ltd.}manufactures wooden fencing panels on the Depot.The wood comes from Portugal. { }
